refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: &dhname; - contains runtime configuration of &dhlpackage; package. It defines the behavior of the service - a client or server, sets the network settings and using OpenSSL keys.
The complete description of the file format and possible parameters held within are here for reference purposes.

refsect1.title: FILE FORMAT
refsect1.para: The file consists of sections and parameters. A section begins with the name of the section in square brackets (or top of the file for global unnamed section) and continues until the next section begins. Unnamed section contain global settings. Sections contain parameters of the form:
or for some special sections contain sequence of "raw" lines, each of which is a unnamed parameter. For example, list of allowed IPv4 networks (CIDR)
Section and parameter names are case sensitive.
Any line beginning with a hash ("#") character is ignored, as are lines containing only whitespace.

refsect1.title: SECTION DESCRIPTIONS
refsect1.para: There are three special sections, unnamed global, [ssl] and [ipsAllowed] which are described under special sections

refsect1.title: SECTION GLOBAL UNNAMED
refsect1.para: This section contain global named parameters:

listitem.para: This parameter can be set to client or server and define the role of &dhlservice;. Service for client role send requests for tunnel creating to the server and check tunnel state, for server role - listen client requests for tunnel creation only.
this parameter define WireGuard tunnel device name
Default: wg0
this parameter define valid hostname or IPv4 address of the server side of &dhlservice;
UDP port number that the WireGuard device of the "server" role will listen on
Default: 12912
It makes sense only for "server" role because the client receives the port number on a successful key exchange.
TCP port number that the daemon of the "server" role will listen on for auth and key exchange
Default: 42912
Default: 0 (disabled)
Threshold time of inactivity, that is recognized as a peer disconnect
This parameter can be presented as a number (of seconds) or as a presentation time string "number<sec|min|hour|day|week|month|year>"
Default: 32minutes
Tunnel IP address of server peer.
It makes sense only for "server" role. The client receives the server tunnel IP-address in the key exchange
Leased mode for client peers. This parameter can be set to dynamic or commonname
It makes sense only for "server" role.
dynamic - set for client peer first free IP address after "ipServer" value
commonname - set for client peer IP address that resolved from their Common Name (CN). In this case, the DNS service must be properly configured.
Default: dynamic

refsect1.title: SECTION ipsAllowed
refsect1.para: [ipsAllowed] section are given sequence of networks (CIDR) permitted to WireGuard tunnel.

refsect1.title: SECTION ssl
refsect1.para: [ssl] section should contain Сommon Names of peers that bind X.509 digital certificates of public key infrastructure (PKI)

listitem.para: Common Name (CN) that refers to the signed server certificate
Common Name (CN) that refers to the signed client certificate
It makes sense only for "client" role. The server receives the client's CN in the key exchange
